comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: bisdak40 on January 31, 2023, 01:21:17 AMcttoDate: March 4, 2023Venue: Toyota Arena, Ontario CaliforniaSo, this is now official as PBC has announced that this fight will take place this coming March 4.For fans of Mark Magsayo, i know that you are eager to watch him rebound on his recent loss to Vargas but for me this is not an easy fight for him.https://www.boxingscene.com/brandon-figueroa-vs-mark-margsayo-showtime-tripleheader-official-march-4--172155This isn't an easy fight for Brandon but so is Figueroa, Brandon is not a hard puncher and loves to fight inside and mix it up, if Magsayo is going to win against Brandon he better make sure that he can last a full 12 rounds because Brandon can keep up as we have seen on his match against Fulton.Brandon throws a lot of punches like Vargas so he should impose himself by connecting big shots, this fight is 50/50 for me but I'm hoping that Magsayo can bring on his best form because Brandon is one tough fighter.

comments.author: Dave1
comments.body: This is going to be very tough for Magsayo as Figueroa is a volume puncher and rugged inside boxer. But it suits Magsayo's style because he is a inside operator as well. The thing for me or the advantage of Mark is that he has the power and could score a knock out victory.He needs this win, to stay on top, otherwise it will be very difficult for him to get another belt in this division.So hopefully he can bounce back again.

comments.author: Yaunfitda
comments.body: Yes, I agree that this is not an easy fight, Figueroa gave Fulton one hell of a fight and there are fans who says that he was robbed on that win. Nevertheless he has move on already and for added motivation, this is for the vacant WBC featherweight championship.So I expect a lot of fireworks in this fight. Yes, Figueroa might not have the power, but he is going up in weight at 126 lbs so maybe the added pounds will have some effect on his power punches.

comments.author: Kemarit
comments.body: I will give the slight advantage to Magsayo in terms of power, but for the work rate, it's Figueroa here. This is probably like the Ceja war, going back and forth and then Mark will caught Figueroa later with a big left causing him to go down and kiss the canvass and not make it.Interim belt and probably after this the winner will against fighting Rey Vargas, and if my chance my prediction will happen, it will be a trilogy for Vargas vs Magsayo.

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: Both fighters need this win, especially Magsayo who just lost a split decision against Vargas this is a very even fight both fighters are capable of delivering a knockout and both fighters can go the distance, the fight could go either way because they have the same style and power, of course, I'm in favor of Magsayo, this is going to be a much tougher fight for Magsayo, Figueroa loves to break down his opponent with his body shots so I hope Magsayo is ready for this.

comments.author: inthelongrun
comments.body: That was quick. Probably both protagonists are already training earlier when the WBC announced mandatories for Vargas-Foster, Fulton-Figueroa II, and Magsayo-Dogboe. Things changed when Fulton opted to remain in his division and defend his WBO and WBC belts to Naoya Inoue. Magsayo then replaced Fulton to challenge Figueroa which makes sense because Dogboe might be difficult to stage since it is handled by a rival promoter Top Rank. I think Dogboe is not interested in a WBC eliminator since he might get a real shot at the vacant WBO belt. I want Magsayo to win but as always, I am not convinced by his skills and stamina. Magsayo is just like Deontay Wilder, low-skilled and relied on their power punches to land hoping their opponents can't take it. So just like when I voted for Vargas earlier to beat Magsayo, I think Figueroa stops Magsayo this time. This fight might be a war if Figueroa decides to brawl. Although Magsayo is probably the bigger guy and Brandon might not be able to take heavy punches in his new division. May the best man win.

comments.author: cryptomaniac_xxx
comments.body: Quote from: aioc on February 01, 2023, 11:10:54 AMBoth fighters need this win, especially Magsayo who just lost a split decision against Vargas this is a very even fight both fighters are capable of delivering a knockout and both fighters can go the distance, the fight could go either way because they have the same style and power, of course, I'm in favor of Magsayo, this is going to be a much tougher fight for Magsayo, Figueroa loves to break down his opponent with his body shots so I hope Magsayo is ready for this.Magsayo's gas tank is questionable though, he might get tire as the rounds go, as compare to Brandon Figueroa who is known to have a deep lungs. So it will be dangerous of Mark if the fight goes to distance as he might lose again on the decision.So for him, it's better to rely on his power here. Yeah, I know he feel in love with his knock out power. And when it didn't come that's where the problem is. Just like against Vargas. It was a war but at the end, the judges gave it to Vargas because of accuracy.

comments.author: yazher
comments.body: Even though Mark Magsayo has the power to knock out Figueroa, he still has a lot to do concerning his training because if he can't execute those power punches, it won't be his secret weapon. This guy is good and really needs to work harder to improve because he has the potential to become a phenomenal champion if only he can get straight wins via K.O. But he always gets nervous and loses focus when the battle begins, giving his opponents some chances to score against him and eventually win against him as he does in his last fight. He better learn to finish his opponent until the judges no longer have doubt in their decisions.

He better learn to finish his opponent until the judges no longer have doubt in their decisions.Just the problem with fighters who just rely on their power, it that failed, they don't have a plan B just like what Magsayo. Figueroa has a solid chin, and he really moves a lot, and if I'm not mistaken, could be a bit taller which is a weakness of Magsayo as well as he had difficulty fighting against boxers that is taller than him. And if it goes to the judges score card, I doubt that Magsayo can also get the decision. So this fight is all or nothing for him at this stage of his career, a lost will put his career on a standstill as he will not to proved himself ready for title shots again.

comments.author: QueenVera
comments.body: This is one of those very difficult matches to predict and most times it because of their rankings and both of them are really great fighters and they are both raked as number one in their various countries and I'm so sure that it wouldn't be an easy fight at all.I really don't think it will be a great fight for megsayo but rather a very difficult one and I'm sure that at his level in his career I'm sure a defeat at this point wouldn't be a nice one for him as it might seem his not ready for the tittle awaiting him and it might be withhold his promotion.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: I don't know anything about Figueroa but I've seen Magsayo fight. Magsayo is a good fighter(despite his recent loss) but still needs a lot of improvement if he plans to dominate during his career. anyway, I'll be biased here and vote for Magsayo to win by decision, it'll be an interesting match to see.
